cards.title: Amor Victor
cards.text: The power of love triumphs in this situation.  Exactly how this happens is for you to describe.

cards.title: Cut Scene
cards.text: Jump forward three hours. Describe what condition the characters find themselves in. You’re not allowed to describe what has happened in the meantime.

cards.title: Flashback
cards.text: Play a scene that has occurred in the past, in the same place where your character is right now. The player who draws the card sets the scene and tells the other players what characters (npcs or their own characters) to control.

cards.title: Haunted by the Past!
cards.text: Something the character has done previously has consequences in the present. Tell the game master what you think this card means.

cards.title: Nemesis!
cards.text: This card awakens the character’s Nemesis.  In some way, their arch enemy affects the situation. Exactly how is up to you. Doesn’t the character have an arch enemy? Well, now she does.

cards.title: The Character Flaw.
cards.text: The last npc the character met has a dark secret, a weak spot or a negative trait. The character doesn’t necessarily know what it is, but it’s up to you as the player to invent and describe it.

cards.title: Do not gaze into the Abyss…
cards.text: The character feels an irresistible urge to do something she will regret. Do it!

cards.title: Masquerade!
cards.text: For the rest of this scene, all players swap characters. This includes the game master.  Give your character sheet to the player at your right.

cards.title: Mood Change
cards.text: Everyone present suddenly change mood to the exact opposite of what they had. The new moods last for the rest of the scene.

cards.title: Inner Monologue
cards.text: Throughout this scene you can at any time point your finger at someone (pc or npc).  That character’s player must stand up and utter a short, inner monologue (say whatever’s on the characters mind at that time).

cards.title: Meanwhile…
cards.text: The scene is cut, and you may establish a new scene somewhere else. You choose who is present. Players may be given npcs to play in this cut scene.

cards.title: Reality Split
cards.text: Things are turned inside out and you experience several timelines simultaneously.  Each other player may in turn describe a different course of events. When the laws of reality catch up, there’s a loud noise and only one of your co-player’s descriptions will have happened. You decide which one.

cards.title: Conscience
cards.text: Two advisors appear, one on each shoulder of one of the characters (pc or npc) present in the scene. Time stops while they try to convince the character of their (opposing) sides to some dilemma. Choose who will be given advice and which two players will control the advisors.

cards.title: Interview
cards.text: Stand up. Your character is interviewed about what happened during this scene.  You may describe freely what happened from your point of view, and your characters thoughts. The other players ask questions, as in a press conference. When the interview is over, you sit down and continue playing the scene where you left off.

cards.title: Prosopopeia
cards.text: Animals, objects or abstract concepts start to talk. Who are talking and what do they have to say?

cards.title: The Shadow
cards.text: Time stops as you have a conversation with you own shadow. The shadow has the same skills and attributes as you, but in addition it may enter places you can’t reach. Will you ask your shadow for help or advice?  The player that looks most like you plays your shadow.

cards.title: Rumour Mill
cards.text: Gossip spreads fast. Tell a rumour about the scene in progress to the person on your left. The rumour is retold from player to player and each time something is changed and exaggerated. By the time the gossip reaches back to you, it has become true.

cards.title: Good Advice
cards.text: You may ask someone for an advice. It may be anyone (pc or npc) and it could be someone who’s dead or otherwise normally impossible to consult. Choose one of the other players to be the advisor and decide how you are communicating. If you follow the advice given to you, you will succeed.  But if you don’t follow the advice you will fail, no matter what.

cards.title: Yes, but…
cards.text: The character succeeds, but something completely unrelated goes wrong, for the character or someone she cares about.

cards.title: Yes, and…
cards.text: The character succeeds, and achieves more than she expected. Perhaps even a bit too much…

cards.title: No, but…
cards.text: The character fails, but another positive thing happens instead, unrelated to what she was aiming for.

cards.title: Help is needed.
cards.text: The character ends up understanding that she needs the help of someone not currently in the scene to achieve this aim.

cards.title: Yes, but only if…
cards.text: The character can get what she wants – but only if she chooses to make a certain sacrifice.

cards.title: Yes, but…
cards.text: The character succeeds, but the consequences of the success are completely different from what was expected.

cards.title: Yes, but…
cards.text: The character succeeds, but there’s a tiny detail that doesn’t go quite as planned.

cards.title: No, and…
cards.text: The character fails, and something unrelated also goes wrong
